title: Pope Francis hospitalized with respiratory infection, Vatican says
description: Pope Francis was hospitalized due to a respiratory infection after experiencing difficulty breathing, according to the Vatican. NBC News’ Anne Thompson has the latest updates on his health.

title: Mexican president points to 'negligence' in deadly migrant detention center fire
description: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador  said there had been "negligence" at the detention center where a fire claimed the lives of 38 migrant men.

title: Russian dad whose teen drew anti-war picture flees jail and exposes cracks in Putin’s crackdown on dissent
description: A single father who was sentenced to jail for discrediting the Russian army was on the run after fleeing detention/

title: Russia stops sharing information on nuclear forces with the U.S.
description: A senior Russian diplomat said Moscow had suspended sharing information about its nuclear forces with the United States, including notices about missile tests.

title: Russian man whose daughter drew anti-war picture flees house arrest
description: A Russian man who was sentenced to two years in a penal colony after his daughter drew a picture of missiles raining down on a Ukrainian family has managed to escape house arrest. After his daughter’s teacher called the police over the drawing, police found that the man had criticized the Russian army on social media, which was made illegal shortly after the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Any Russian victory could be perilous, Ukraine’s Zelenskyy warns
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned Tuesday that unless his nation wins a drawn-out battle in a key eastern city, Russia could begin building international support for a deal that could require Ukraine to make unacceptable compromises.

title: Elephant in the dining room: Startup creates mammoth meatball
description: Australian startup Vow is aiming to start a conversation about the future of cultivated meat products with its surreal innovation using genetic code from a mammoth.

title: Senate set to pass repeal of authorizations for Gulf and Iraq wars
description: The Senate is expected to pass bipartisan legislation on Wednesday that would repeal the authorizations Congress passed in 1991 and 2002 for the U.S. wars in Iraq.

title: Australian start up unveils ‘mammoth meatball’ made from mastodon genetics
description: The Australian company Vow unveiled its “mammoth meatball,” a lab-grown meatball made using the genetic sequence from the long-extinct mastodon. The meatball was created by combining publicly available genetic data from the woolly mammoth and its closest living relative, the African elephant, and inserting it into a sheep cell. Advocates say lab-grown meat, which is produced without the use of livestock, could help reduce the environmental impact of global meat production.

title: Bakhmut must be defended to stop Putin building support, Zelenskyy says
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that unless his nation wins a drawn-out battle in Bakhmut, Russia could begin building international support.

title: Former Taiwanese leader on visit to China says war must be avoided
description: Former Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou called on Taipei and Beijing to do all they can to avoid war during a historic visit to the Chinese city of Nanjing.

title: Myanmar's military junta dissolves Suu Kyi’s party and most of the opposition
description: Myanmar’s military government took another major step in its ongoing campaign to cripple its political opponents on Wednesday, dissolving dozens of opposition parties including that of ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi for failing to meet a registration deadline ahead of elections.
